page.title: 09NEWCASTLETONS AUCTION MART
page.content:
{ { {NEWCASTLETON'S AUCTION MART
There is an Auction{Mart}at {Newcastleton}Village. On Tuesday the 14th of may 1985. Mr Inch of the Auctioneers showed us round. He was built in the 1880's. It is the oldest Suckler Sale in the British Isles also it is the largest sale of Blue-Grey {Calves}also in the British Isles. It has only slightly changed since it was built in the 1880's.the{mart}has an opened top roof.In those days (the 1880's onwards until 1969)the {lambs}and{calves}were either driven by train or driven on foot, when the railway closed down in 1969 there were lorries to drive them.There are 5{lamb}sales and 4{calve}sales every year.-
